thread.title: We’re willing to bet Boston made a lot of babies during last year’s historic blizzard. - News
thread.title_full: We’re willing to bet Boston made a lot of babies during last year’s historic blizzard. - News

author: boston.com
title: We’re willing to bet Boston made a lot of babies during last year’s historic blizzard. - News
text:
Winter Storm Juno obliterated New England at the end of last January. The historically nasty blizzard shut down the city for days at a time, and there wasn’t much to do in Boston around that time other stay inside and bide time.
That was around nine months ago.
We can’t assume that every Boston baby born in the coming weeks was conceived during blizzard boredom. But, as Reddit user WarMace suggested on /r/Boston on October 20, there’s a pretty good chance that some of them were.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below So we have a task for you, Boston.com readers: if you or someone you know is having a baby in the next few weeks and they are a product of the blizzard, we’d love to know—and, if possible, see a photo of the blizzard baby in question. These photos will be featured in a story that highlights Boston’s cutest “blizzard babies.”
Send in pics of your best blizzard babies via e-mail by sending photos to emily.anderson@boston.com . Or, you can post them in the comments to this Facebook thread.
